body: @RoganW  我想知道你是怎么使用翻译文件的  我是把message.po文件放在flask appbuilder 的一个文件家里 然后再操作  你的babel extract 有什么作用， 如果整个message文件里面没有这些flask 的内容你再翻译时候这些， flask的内容是没有翻译的 你还能单独控制再让flask -appbuilder 把自己的内容也翻译一下？？？
Same issue here

Ok so this is the fillna(0) in BaseViz.get_df(). It looks like with [fillna](https://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/generated/pandas.DataFrame.fillna.html) we can be a bit more smart and try to pass a specific value depending on the column. What do you think?
I did the pip upgrade last friday and saw the same behavior. But i'm not sure if superset was upgraded. Let me check it tomorrow.
So is this a TEXT field as a metric in PivotViz?

@RoganW  谢谢你的提醒, 我是按照一个社区提供的文档进行翻译的, 那个文档写的时候可能还没有你提供的translate 官方说明 但是我看了一眼你提供的fab的两个命令 实际就是操作fab项目下的文件 只是用的superset文件夹下面的一个文件,最后将整个翻译过程简化,,,,
当然这些都不是我们现在讨论的重点, 我没有试过你的方案, 我直接用你当初提供的只针对superset 的文档翻译 会导致很多fab 的内容没有翻译,我这个pr 也是为了说明这个问题,不知道你那里情况是否和我一样, 
而且有一个问题,正常pip 安装superset 是没有tanslations 这个文件夹的 , 大部分人使用都应该直接pip 安装而不是源码编译 , 最后的如果进行翻译操作,应该就会和我选择同样的方案, 直接次改fab 文件内容, 如果这样的话一个完整的翻译文档会简单直接一点,,
你明白我意思了吗
It's a TEXT as breakdown / column in a DistributionBarViz
I think we want an url to the built documentation and not to the source files.

The following fixes the issue for me, what do you think? If you are fine with the idea i'll add tests and open a PR.
```
diff --git a/superset/connectors/base.py b/superset/connectors/base.py
index e203ef44..81f1e387 100644
--- a/superset/connectors/base.py
+++ b/superset/connectors/base.py
@@ -65,6 +65,10 @@ class BaseDatasource(AuditMixinNullable, ImportMixin):
         return sorted([c.column_name for c in self.columns])
 
     @property
+    def columns_types(self):
+        return {c.column_name: c.type for c in self.columns}
+
+    @property
     def main_dttm_col(self):
         return "timestamp"
 
diff --git a/superset/viz.py b/superset/viz.py
index 75cb4113..0aad73f6 100755
--- a/superset/viz.py
+++ b/superset/viz.py
@@ -42,6 +42,7 @@ class BaseViz(object):
     verbose_name = "Base Viz"
     credits = ""
     is_timeseries = False
+    default_fillna = 0
 
     def __init__(self, datasource, form_data):
         if not datasource:
@@ -60,6 +61,20 @@ class BaseViz(object):
         self.status = None
         self.error_message = None
 
+    def get_fillna_for_type(self, col_type):
+        """Returns the value for use as filler for a specific Column.type"""
+        if col_type == 'TEXT':
+            return '<None>'
+        return self.default_fillna
+
+    def get_fillna_for_columns(self, columns=None):
+        """Returns a dict or scalar that can be passed to DataFrame.fillna"""
+        if columns is None:
+            return self.default_fillna
+        columns_types = self.datasource.columns_with_types
+        fillna = {c: self.get_fillna_for_type(columns_types.get(c)) for c in columns}
+        return fillna
+
     def get_df(self, query_obj=None):
         """Returns a pandas dataframe based on the query object"""
         if not query_obj:
@@ -101,7 +116,8 @@ class BaseViz(object):
                 if self.datasource.offset:
                     df[DTTM_ALIAS] += timedelta(hours=self.datasource.offset)
             df.replace([np.inf, -np.inf], np.nan)
-            df = df.fillna(0)
+            fillna = self.get_fillna_for_columns(self)
+            df = df.fillna(fillna)
         return df
 
     def get_extra_filters(self):
```
Are you installing from git? If so you have forget to build the static files: https://github.com/ApacheInfra/superset/blob/master/docs/installation.rst#making-your-own-build
No I am not, actually. Upgrading Superset via PIP. Shouldn't I ?
Your screenshot shows that you are requesting files for the 0.18.4 version so are you sure you never installed from git? If it's a virtualenv the checkout is inside src instead of lib.

Never installed Superset from git, always via `pip install superset`. Did a `pip install superset --upgrade` , since then I get these errors.

I have restarted the Linux. but it still says .018.4
@mistercrunch Where was this addressed? Your reference does not solve this for all visualisations, and I'm not finding another one?

pip uninstall superset
pip install superset. (and the other steps) and now I can read 0.18.5. :)

the bad side is that I still have the nested scroll bars.

![imagen](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28396794/27541728-66c4b328-5a5b-11e7-8e79-49fad898c0b5.png)
I see there's already an implementation of refresh on resize for the slice but it's not called when the slice is initialized, any hint on where the slice is initialized in the explorer view?
Is there any other feedback on this?  We're seeing hte same issues.  We got around it by casting our original ts to a varchar but it feels "dirty".
Ultimately (hopefully soon) this will be on Apache infra. https://superset.apache.org/
Please add all the missing information from the bug report template.

ENV: python3.5 and superset 0.17.5
1.The superset is running long, today i create a sclice in web,
i don't know what happened?  Then i click  sclices tab in the web, this error:"500 - Internal Server Error"

2.I analyze these error detail,
"File "/usr/local/python3/lib/python3.5/json/decoder.py", line 339, in decode
obj, end = self.raw_decode(s, idx=_w(s, 0).end())
File "/usr/local/python3/lib/python3.5/json/decoder.py", line 357, in raw_decode
raise JSONDecodeError("Expecting value", s, err.value) from None
json.decoder.JSONDecodeError: Expecting value: line 1 column 1 (char 0)"

3.I suspect that  it's related to the Python version.

**4.I install an new superset with python2.7.5,configure metadata with config.py.**

**5.Install this command with "pip install Flask-WTF==0.14"**

**6.Start the new superset,open the web,click sclices tab, 
and i find that there one sclice with name is null in the web. I delete this sclice.**

7.Refresh the original superset web, it's ok.
I closed it.
Any additional reviews on this PR?
I really doubt that the python version affects the UI. Possibly using a different superset version?

@caoxiaozh - no luck so far. It builds fine on local machine but on build machines, I get errors due to external dependencies.

@yagrawal3 Don't build it on your remote machines; run the pypi script on your local machine, then go to the dist folder and upload the newly created tar file to your remote server, then go to your server to unzip the file and run python install.

run these:
file=airflow.cfg
cp $file $file.bk
sed -i 's#load_examples = True#load_examples = False#g' $file
bin/airflow resetdb

bin/airflow initdb


restart your airflow, you should be good without examples.


Thank you!

Alex

@Frituurpanda @vera-liu **I also have the same problem.**

Update - I contacted clamscan team and reported this as false positive. 
They have dropped the matching signature in their daily update - 
http://lists.clamav.net/pipermail/clamav-virusdb/attachments/20170630/90014a4b/attachment.ksh

closing this now.
Hi, @STILLSHI. It's due to `django.db.backends.sqlite3.base.SQLiteCursorWrapper`, maybe you should try `%%zh` instead of `%zh`.

version: 0.18.5
Database：mysql5.7

1、download the .mo .po file and remove it under the superset dir.

2、under the superset dir:mkdir -p translations/zh/LC_MESSAGES.

3、Finally I run $ "pybabel compile -d translations". This generate the /tranlations/zh_CN/LC_MESSAGES/messages.mo successfully.

4、run "superset runserver".

have a try!
thank you.

@STILLSHI You see, the error message is changed into `unsupported format character ''' (0x27)`. Then you do not realize that this new log message is telling us that should change the `'%%zh中文%'` into `'%%zh中文%%'`?
@STILLSHI Actually, we shouldn't use the chinese as the name of database tables, because it will bring too many problems and looks not professional ;)
